page.title: 02VICTORIAN WEEK
page.content: Every year in Llandrindod Wells there is a Victorian week.It started in 1982 because Llandrindod Wells used to be a Victorian town.To open the week we have a festival opening.All through the week people are able to ride in a horse-drawn carriage.Most people dress up in victorian costume during the week and the children are allowed to wear their costumes to school.At the Holy Trinity Church there is an exhibition of victorian Reformers.The shop owners decorate their shop windows as if they were Victorian shops.In Middleton St there is a street party for children.At the end of the week there is a torchlight procession where everyone carries a torch.The procession goes around all the hotels and then to the lake for a firework display.
